thread.title: Evil Dead: The Game Delisted

title: Evil Dead: The Game Delisted
text:
Evil Dead: The Game is no longer available for purchase for PC, as the
PvPvE multiplayer game based on the Evil Dead movies and shows is no longer for
sale on
Steam, while its Epic
Games Store Listing is just gone without a trace. Its Epic launch came
less than three years ago and it
arrived on Steam
barely two
years ago as a Game of the Year Edition (showing how quickly pride can turn
to shame). Development on the game
ended
in 2023, and it seems logical that this news is because a licensing deal
expired. And though no longer sold, the game can still be played by those who
own it already, so it's surprising it was pulled with no advance notice from
Saber Interactive. A
terse update offers thanks to players, including "those who have recently
joined us," while offering no apologies or refunds:
We can confirm we've begun the process of removing the game from digital storefronts. Anyone who has purchased the game will still be able to play it as we plan to keep our servers online for everyone.
We want to extend a sincere thank you to our community, to those who have been part of the game from the very beginning, and those who have recently joined us. We appreciate all of your support.
